meta.content: Caseville Public School Soar Higher! 6609 Vine Street Caseville, MI 48725 989-856-2311

br.font:
Soar Higher!
6609 Vine Street
Caseville, MI 48725

strong.font: Caseville Public School is excited to announce we will begin free weekly meal pick up for all children! Please help us by getting the word out! Here are the details:
1. Meal pick up will be done on Saturdays from 10AM-12PM curbside at Caseville Public School. Your school age child(ren) will receive five breakfast and five lunch meals for the following week.

2. Orders must be placed Tuesday of each week by noon (12PM) Simply email Mrs. Glaza, our Food Service Director and let her know how many children you are ordering food for. These DO NOT need to be Caseville Public School students. ANY school age student, including preschool will qualify for meals. Mrs. Glaza's email is cglaza@cpseagles.org

3. On Saturdays you will pull into the main school parking lot, open your trunk and a school employee will verify the family you are picking up for and load your meals.
​
That easy! There are NO income requirements and once again you do not need to be a Caseville Public School student. We need your participation to make this program program possible so please sign up!

div.strong:
On April 2, 2020, Governor Whitmer issued Executive Order 2020-35 which effectively closed all K-12 school buildings for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Under this order, school districts are expected to develop a “Continuity of Learning Plan” so that students can continue to learn from home. Currently, our teachers have developed and communicated plans individually with students and parents. They have utilized different ways to communicate such as Skyward, Classtag and Google Classrooms.
In order for our teachers to properly communicate with you, it is important that your current email is up to date in Skyward. If you would like to update your email, please email Mrs. Sancrant at jsancrant@cpseagles.org with your new information. You can also email your child’s teacher directly. All teacher emails are listed on our website here: http://www.cpseagles.org/teachers.html.
If you need a Chromebook for your student to work from at home, please be sure to contact Mrs. Koslowski and we will be sure to loan one to you during this time. Her email is mkoslowski@cpseagles.org.
As far as the rest of the year goes, we will continue to provide updates to you via mail, email, Facebook and on our website. In the meantime, here are a few things we currently know:
· Seniors who were on track to graduate will still graduate.
· We still plan to have a Graduation Ceremony for our senior class. This is scheduled for June 7 and the date is based on the Governor’s Stay at Home Order and is subject to change. Details of Graduation will be communicated with senior students.
· Students in lower grade levels who were on track to advance will advance.
· All Spring Sports are cancelled.
· All school activities are cancelled for this school year including Prom, 8th Grade Graduation, the Reward Trip and 7th Grade Camp.
· We will continue to provide food through our local Food Pantry to all of our families. There will be a food truck this Tuesday, April 14 at 11am in the school parking lot. Please make plans to come!
· Report cards and more information will be sent home by early next week. Please be on the lookout for this mailing.
We understand there are a lot of questions still regarding the future and want to ensure you that we are doing everything we can to answer them as we are able. We appreciate your patience as we all try to move forward in this difficult time.
Thank you!
GO EAGLES!
Click below for access to these online resources!

div.h2: You can help us write the history of 2020

img.style: margin-top: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 10px; border-width:1px;padding:3px; max-width:100%

span.style: display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; font-size: 90%; margin-top: -10px; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center;

div.font:
​Digital Media class is working hard to create our first digital newsletter and the 2020 Yearbook. In order to create the best possible final product, we would like to enlist the help of our students, parents, and community. Please help us by submitting any pictures of our Caseville students being awesome. Great photographs make a great yearbook and we want you to be a part of the fun.
Go to yearbookforever.com to access the Community Upload feature, or just download the Yearbook Snap app. Use the access code: eagles to upload your pictures.
CASEVILLE PUBLIC SCHOOL * 6609 VINE STREET * CASEVILLE, MI 48725 * 989-856-2311
